security_audit.summary: This is a pure prompt-based skill consisting only of documentation. No executable code, no scripts, no network access, no file system access beyond local configuration. The skill provides instructions to modify a local JSON state file and confirm changes to the user. All 16 static findings are false positives caused by keyword pattern matching without semantic context.

content.value_statement: Claude Router captures insights automatically during your work. This skill lets you disable that continuous learning mode when you prefer manual control over what gets recorded. Use it to pause automatic extraction for privacy-sensitive work or controlled knowledge management.
actual_capabilities: Read current learning mode state from knowledge/state.json
Update state to disable learning mode
Write modified state back to knowledge/state.json
Display session summary with extraction statistics
Confirm learning mode status to user
Show captured insights count before disabling
limitations: Only disables automatic extraction, not manual /learn commands
Does not delete existing captured insights
Cannot re-enable learning mode (use /learn-on skill instead)

use_cases.title: Stop automatic data collection
use_cases.description: Disable continuous learning when working with sensitive or confidential information

use_cases.title: Control insight gathering
use_cases.description: Pause automated insights during specific project phases or client work

use_cases.title: Manual knowledge management
use_cases.description: Switch to manual extraction workflow for precise control over captured insights

prompt_templates.title: Confirm status
prompt_templates.prompt: Turn off learning mode and show me the session summary

prompt_templates.title: Privacy focus
prompt_templates.prompt: Disable learning mode before I start working with confidential code

prompt_templates.title: Workflow switch

best_practices: Use before working with sensitive or proprietary code to prevent automatic data capture
Review extracted insights periodically with the /knowledge command
Re-enable with /learn-on when you want automatic knowledge capture again
anti_patterns: Disabling learning mode assumes you will remember to use /learn manually when needed
Do not expect previously captured insights to be deleted when disabling
Avoid leaving learning disabled permanently if you rely on automatic knowledge capture

faq.question: Is my data deleted when I disable learning mode?
faq.answer: No. Existing insights remain stored. Only automatic extraction stops going forward.

faq.question: Can I still capture insights manually?
faq.answer: Yes. Use the /learn command for manual extraction anytime, even with learning disabled.

faq.question: What happens to my query history?
faq.answer: Query counting stops while disabled, but past statistics remain visible when you re-enable.

faq.question: Is this skill safe to use in professional environments?
faq.answer: Yes. It only modifies local state and does not transmit any data externally.

faq.question: How do I re-enable learning mode?
faq.answer: Use the /learn-on skill to reactivate automatic insight extraction when ready.

faq.question: Does this affect Claude Code differently than Claude?
faq.answer: No. Both tools use the same knowledge state file and learning mechanism.
